summary: This document is a series of training attendance rosters for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for the week of April 1-5, 2019. It lists numerous custody and administrative personnel who attended mandatory annual training sessions on topics like whistleblower rights, information security, and managing inmates with disabilities. The document is significant as it provides a roster of staff present at the facility around the time Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there.

events.title: MCC NY Staff Training Day 1
events.description: Custody and administrative staff at MCC New York attended annual training sessions on topics including Reporting Wrongdoing/Whistleblowers, Weapons of Mass Destruction, and Continuity of Operations.

events.title: MCC NY Staff Training Day 2
events.description: Custody and administrative staff at MCC New York attended annual training sessions on Information Security Awareness and Managing Inmates with Disabilities.

events.title: MCC NY Staff Training Day 3
events.description: Custody and administrative staff at MCC New York attended annual training sessions and a quarterly Special Housing Unit (SHU) training.

events.title: MCC NY Staff Training Day 4
events.description: Custody and administrative staff at MCC New York attended the final day of annual training sessions.

locations.name: 26 Federal Plaza, 6th Floor, Classroom 1
locations.context: The location where the MCC New York staff training sessions were held in April 2019.

locations.name: MCC New York
locations.context: The Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, the facility where the listed staff members worked. This is where Jeffrey Epstein was later incarcerated.

keyFacts: The document is a training attendance record for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for the week of April 1-5, 2019, several months before Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death there.
It lists 29 named custody and administrative staff members, providing a roster of personnel present at the facility during this period.

Training topics included whistleblower rights, information security, managing inmates with disabilities, and Special Housing Unit (SHU) procedures, which are relevant to correctional facility operations and inmate management.
The consistent attendance of the same core group of custody officers across all training days suggests standard staffing patterns at MCC New York.

This document establishes the presence of specific staff members at the facility, which could be relevant for investigations into facility operations and procedures during the time Epstein was held there.
